name: SDR VFO A - San Francisco Memory Bank
Fan Full Example: input from device, output to device
info:
# Fan V2 This example shows a fan. The inputs from node red are to turn the fan on, off, or set "No Response". The outputs going to "Fan output" will show: On / off state
Rotation speed
Swing mode on / off (oscillate)
Rotation direction (clockwise/counterclockwise)

name: Color Bulb: input from device, output to device
info:
# Color Bulb

This is a color bulb. It accepts and sends out Hue, Saturation, Value, and On/off state.

Hue is the color

Saturation is how deep the color is

Value is brightness

On is power state

name: Dimmable Bulb: input from device, output to device
info:
# Dimmable Bulb

This is a dimmable bulb. The Characteristic Properties enable brightness. It is a white bulb which can be adjusted from 0 to 100% brightness.

name: Air Purifier: input power state, output commands device
info:
Turning the device on or off will send: `{"Active":[0, 1]}` After changing power state, the device will be "Turning on" or "Turning off" until a current state is sent of: `{"CurrentAirPurifierState":[0, 1, 2]}` 0: off
1: idle
2: on
There will be a slider in the home app for sending `RotationSpeed` There will be a switch on Home app for "Oscillate" which sends: `{"SwingMode":[0,1]}` Changing mode to manual to auto will send payload: `{"TargetAirPurifierState":[0, 1]}` Child lock will send `{"LockPhysicalControls": [0, 1]}`

name: CO plus CO2 Sensor: input only sensor
info:
# Combined Sensor This is a sensor which will display both Carbon Monoxide (poisonous, deadly gas) and Carbon Dioxide (what humans exhale) levels. # CO Sensor There are three inputs to this example, one for each level of Carbon Monoxide in the air. Options are: **0 ppm:** this will assume no CO in the air
**Low level:** this will assume a level between 1 and 35 ppm, inclusive. This level is generally assumed to not cause problems in healthy adults
**Dangerous level:** this will assume a level between 35 and 5000, inclusive; this will also trigger an alert in Home app ## IF YOU HAVE A CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR EVER READING ABOVE 35 PPM, PLEASE EVACUATE THE AREA AND SEEK FRESH AIR IMMEDIATELY TO AVOID RISK OF DEATH ## # CO2 Sensor There are three inputs to this example, one for each level of Carbon Dioxide in the air. Options are: **0 ppm:** this will assume no CO2 in the air
**CO2 Level:** this will assume a level between 1 and 100,000 ppm, inclusive
**Dangerous level:** this will assume a level between 1,000 and 100,000, inclusive

name: Contact Sensor: input only sensor
info:
# Contact Sensor

The contact sensor has one inject node to Open the sensor (door, window, etc). Once open, a ten second timer will run then set it back to closed.

Additional inputs are for "No Response", "Tampered", and "Battery". Note that this battery will not show a battery level but only a good/low battery status.

name: CO2 Sensor: input only sensor
info:
# CO2 Sensor There are three inputs to this example, one for each level of Carbon Dioxide in the air. Options are: **0 ppm:** this will assume no CO2
**Safe level:** this will assume a level between 1 and 999 ppm, inclusive
**Dangerous level:** this will assume a level between 1,000 and 100,000, inclusive; this will also trigger an alert

name: Air Quality with Battery: input only sensor
info:
# Air Quality Sensor

This sensor will inject random values for all of the air quality metrics available in the HomeKit spec. It will also inject random values for a linked battery service.

Watch the input and Home app to learn how to see how things are working.

name: Fan Simplified: input from device, output to device
info:
# Fan Simple This example is for a 3-speed fan. Speeds are:
Low = 33
Medium = 66
High = 99
Values outside of this are restricted and will not work. The home app will "snap" to these values. Siri will respond to "set fan to low/medium/high" with the corresponding value.

name: Fan Full Example: input from device, output to device
info:
# Fan V2 This example shows a fan. The inputs from node red are to turn the fan on, off, or set "No Response". The outputs going to "Fan output" will show: On / off state
Rotation speed
Swing mode on / off (oscillate)
Rotation direction (clockwise/counterclockwise)

return msg;
